{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3599160,"name":"COLTech Robotics","username":"COLTech9059","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T22:56:17.713Z","cooked":"

Hello! This is one of the members of the programming team of COLTech Robotics here.

I am currently trying to create some methods for our vision subsystem, but I am getting increasingly frustrated with it. I am not getting any errors reported, yet the function does nothing.

I have found several places where it COULD be going wrong, but it’s not making sense to me as to why it’s not working. (targetObservation happening to be a blank observation on every request, cameras somehow not being connected, even though they are reported connected in NetworkTables)

NetworkTables are getting proper updated signals, but it seems that the code isn’t able to grab said updated data.

image800×502 28.7 KB

The code above is meant to get the angle (in radians) to the AprilTag and simply make the front of the robot parallel with the tag’s plane.

image826×691 34.7 KB

This code determines the best camera to use for target centering. We have two cameras.

We also use commands (as shown in the first picture) for interacting with subsystems.

Help is (obviously) appreciated!

Repository Link

p.s., we use the AZ-RBSI template as a base.

Are your camera names correct? Can you show some screenshots of the PhotonVision web UI with the names of the cameras?

They are also named in the code.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T20:30:22.047Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":27.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500060,"topic_slug":"confusion-with-photonvision","display_username":"COLTech Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56608,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/confusion-with-photonvision/500060/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3600997,"name":"","username":"gold856","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ce7236/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T03:44:25.544Z","cooked":"

The problem is with how you’re calling determineBestCamera. You’re calling it in the body of the method, which means it gets called when the method runs, not when the Command runs. Examination of your codebase indicates you call OrientToAprilTagPlane once to bind the command to a button, meaning determineBestCamera gets called once when your code starts up. Most likely, PhotonVision hasn’t had a chance to connect to your code by that point, so determineBestCamera returns -1, and you bind Commands.none() to your button. For a similar reason, even if camToUse wasn’t -1, yaw is also calculated once on startup, and so you would likely see your robot always try to go to the same angle each time you run the Command. The solution is you need to put all these calculations into the lambda responsible for calculating yaw. That way, yaw is recalculated as the command runs instead of once on startup.

Yep, that was the issue. Thanks for the insight!
